column2: HappyG, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Been taking this med for 3 months lost 32lb. I do worry about what will happen when I quit taking this med will I keep the weight off or will I put it back on. I really hope not I like being able to play with my kids and I like how I don't feel sick all the time..

column2: GladILostWeight, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started 3 months ago needing to lose 50 lbs. My blood pressure was 150/100 with medication. Now, 3 months later, using this medication and restricting my diet to high protein, low carbs  low calories  I am within 5 lbs of my target. It has been easy actually. And my blood pressure  using only half the medication previously used  is 120/80 range. I have had a couple of side-effects...One is constipation. You need to drink plenty of water. The other is erectile dysfunction. Never really dealt with that before  but I am assuming it is the effects of the pills (at least I hope it is). I guess I will find out in a couple of weeks when I go into maintenance mode..Other than that  my experience has been overall very positive...

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This med is great it has helped me lose 1.5 to 2 pounds a week without feeling any side-affects. I am now focused on living the rest of my life healthy.

column2: chris559, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i have been on this med for 1mon i have lost ten lbs i read a review about cramps in the legs i have that problem also usually the the lower leg but not enough to stop me from taking this med. overall it works great!!!

column2: Cph, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: my starting weight was 200lbs and now way 175, I started taking the med in October but had to stop a wk or 2 into it, due having to have my gall bladder removed (which had NOTHING to do with this med, it had been bother some for years). I then started this med again in January and was still around 200lbs. I stayed on the med, did not exercise and lost 30lbs. around May i stopped this med in May (because it is a short term med- 6 months at a time). I did not have any major side effects just found it hard to sleep if i took it after 4pm. i usually only took 2 in AM and 2 at lunch time and watched my diet, reduced my fat in-take a lot. I was able to keep my weight around 175-179 and decided that i wanted to go back on it, and have been on it since 7/6/10 and have not lost very much. I think i am going to switch to Phentermine and see if it works for me. I would like to get to 150 where i feel comfortable being able to maintaine my own weght with out taking a pill.

column2: L.M., 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started taking this drug in October. I take three pills a day at 35 mg. each. I love it. It helps curve my appetite. I had first started taking my pills only on my work days; I work 12 hour shifts. i found that I would eat more on my days off. I was still losing my target weight every month, but it scared me thinking I would only go back to eating after I got off this pill. I have lost 32lbs. and have 50 more to go.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
AUGIRL, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking this for about 6 weeks now and I've lost 25 pounds.  I've cut out all sodas and drink only water and hit the gym at least 3 days a week.  I'm so excited to see such great results in such little time.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i have taken these pills before and love them. I went to a clinic and got these pills under supervision. I had some side effects in the begining like anxiety and the jitters but after a week they wore off. They did always make me hyper though, I have a low tolerance for stimulants. Needless to say, I saw a review where someone was scared to ween off the pills and I wanted to say that because the clinic got to prioy for me, I had to ween myself off. I went from 6 35mg pills a day to three than two then none.. I was SO scared about gaining it back, I continued to watch somewhat of what I ate.. I was a bad girl... but I also worked out like a mad women. Originally I lost 60 pounds in 4 months.. I have always been over weight and did not want to gain anything back becuase I planned on going back tot he clinic. I went back today and only gained 4 pounds but lost 2.5 percent body fat... So i lost inches! I am now back no the pills and more excited than ever! I love being able to know I am going to lose weight and feel awesome about it! These pills worked wonders for me!

column2: Isabella, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This drug helped me to lose 50 lbs. When I first took the drug I felt "light-headed" but that symptom ended soon afterwards. It is a stimulant and as a result it greatly decreased my appetitie, and increased my energy. When I stopped taking the drug it had a rebound effect--I got tired and hungry. In addition, when taken for several months it no longer has the same effect.

column2: karen2245, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i have been trying to control my weight issues for years.  tried every diet, exercise program, medication,  all together and separtely...anyway this medication worked best for me and was easy to slowly get off of only because it became to costly to go to the nutritionist weekly and my family dr was against this medication.  my blood results were the best they ever have been in years and yet the dr will not write a rx for them and the nutritionist says come backwhen you can afford to see her again.  go figure i find something that helped and because i can not afford 65.0/week for this medication from the nutritionist i can not get to where i need to be..

column2: JC1105, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for about one month.  I lost 8lbs so far.  I was prescribed 105 mg divided into 3 pills per day.  For the most part I take 2 pills per day because I end up forgetting at some point during the day.  I don't get jitters or constipation like I did with phentermine (that was initially prescribed to me).  I like that I still eat, I just get full after much less.  With phentermine I was just not eating since I was never hungry. I do cardio exercise 2/per week and eat a low fat diet.  I also try and stay away from bread. I think I would have lost more weight but I have been cheating the last 2 weeks - mostly because I forget to take the 3rd pill.

column2: timeforchange, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started this med about 2months now with a low-calorie diet and exercise. I am also a pharmacist. The medication will help you gain the energy necessary to start exercise. But, you body starts to develop tolerance. It has helped me lose 24lbs in 7wks, but the truth is the low-calorie no carb with exercise is really the benefit. It takes years to add on pds so don't look for overnight solutions. You have to burn 3500 calories to lose 1 pound. Don't look to take this medication for more than 3 months. It won't be very effective after that. But, it's cheap so do as you please...

column2: lorif, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column9: On a medically supervised plan, lost 60 lbs in 4 mos. Felt fine, but on mos 6 went for GYN appt and Dr noticed heart murmur that was not there the mo before for my annual physical. I did read heart valve problems as a low possible side effect. Coincidence?

column2: lynn, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I took this medicine in 2001 and lost about 30 lbs in about four months. I gained a little back (I was to small) and I looked great. In 05 I had gall bladder surgery and I kept gaining weight. I have taken the pills off and on since the first weight loss and have not stuck to them consistently to see the same results. Today 6/12/08 I am going back on for real, and I know its all about diet and exercise. The pill just helps you keep with a 1000-1200 calorie a day diet + energy. The pill does keep u up if u take it late, and I have experienced heart flutters in the past, but it seemed to only be when I was really hungre...(dont know what that was about.) This pill works and I never write reviews. Just eat better and exercise at least 30 min. First time I lost I didnt exercise that much, but the longer your on the meds u have to work harder. The pills don't work as easy as the first time. Hope was helpfull

column2: mschele, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for two weeks. I have lost a total of 14.5lbs under a medically supervised weight loss program and don't feel any adverse side effects.  I am pleasantly surprised.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It increases anxiety, I made me feel like I could not breath on this medication causing me to have a panic attack.

column2: StPeteMOM, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: On Monday May 19, 2008 I started taking Phendimetrazine 35mg.  I was nervous and skeptical.  I weighed in at 212 lbs.  Today Sunday May 25, 2008 I have lost almost 12 lbs.  I take a pill an hour before each meal and so far its never made me jittery which I was afraid of it doing.  Im following my doctors plan  no more than 4grams of Carbs and no more than 2 grams of saturated fats and not to eat anything with ose in the ingredients.  You eat 100 grams of protein a day and I now can have vegetables with my protein.  My doctor also gave me a list of foods that are safe such as cucumbers, lettuce, and sugar free jello to eat which I can eat anytime I want.  Included was a list of fast foods that I can eat from different fast food restaurants.  Im really excited to see what my results will be in a month.  I didnt think this was going to work at first...but now Im a believer.  Of course Ill have to write a review when its time for me to get off the Phendimetrazine.  I also got a B12 shot.  I felt a little warm/ flushed when I received the shot.  I woke up the next morning at 5am and felt great and ready to begin my weight loss program.   If youre considering this method keep a positive outlook and know you can do it!!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication now for a week. Prior to this medication I had concerns since I have a history of a rapid heart beat however, this medication has not increased my heart rate and has completely erased all my cravings. Together with diet and exercise I have lost 4 pounds.

column2: ddy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have lost 101.4 lbs in 8 months 1 week.  I never felt like I was taking anything. I never noticed any change in how I felt at all except I think I must not be as hungry and don't seem to crave anything.  It has been easy to stick to the diet and I have the energy to exercise as well.  I am going to Medizone Clinic weekly and can't tell you what a difference this has made in my life.  I have 20 lbs more to go to reach my ideal weight of 130.  I have done every diet there is and this program is the best.  I am no longer on a diet. This is how I eat and I love it.  The diet is based on the book the Zone.

column2: reveva, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have lost 54 lbs. so far with about 20lbs. to go. I have not tryed to stop takeing the pil after starting. That is yet to come when I reach my desired weight. I am under a drs. care.

column2: sugarfoot, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started using this medication on  01/22/2008 and I have lost 37 pounds, I am very please and I will continue until I reach my goal.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I have lost almost 50 pounds 5 months (size 18 to a size 4). I fully believe I wouldn't have been this successful without this drug. I NEVER diet because I have no will-power, but this medication allowed me to stick with my diet EVEN THROUGH THE HOLIDAYS! Not only do I feel like it curbed by appetite, I also think it dulls cravings.  Since the drug is so effective at curbing your hunger, you do need to be conscious of your need to eat (at least small amounts) regularly whether you are hungry or not.  My husband & I did this diet together and were instructed by the doctor not to eat unless we were "hungry". We learned quickly that our bodies tell us we are hungry by more than our stomachs growling.  I've learned that when my brain "stops working" (can't think clearly, easily) I need to eat, regardless of whether I FEEL hungry.  I saw another reviewer describe what they termed "short term memory loss" (losing keys, forgetting things, etc) as a side-effect.  The reveiwer went on to say that doctor said this was not a known side-effect others had experienced. I think the pill was effectively keeping this reviewer from being hungry, but the lack (amount and/or frequency) of food was preventing proper brain function.  If you take the pills, eat regularly and DON'T try to live off protein alone.  This is great for a few days, but you need carbs (unstarchy vegetables are best) to function.

column2: momPR, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Here;s the bottom line - I did lose weight.  BUT I experienced very fluttery heart beats, scary rapid heart rate, dizzy blurry vision - scared so much I went and had a whole series of heart exams.  We need to be very careful with this drug!

column2: rjspell, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I lost 25 pounds using as directed---had more energy to exercise.-Did get tired easier as I stopped using--I have kept the weight off though!

column2: malu, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this is very effective I started 2 wks ago already loss 8 lbs had mild side effects (tachycardia)on the 1st week but it went away.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I have tried this drug 3 times and each time it has been effective in losing the weight.  I only had 20 lbs. to lose, and lost 8 - 10 lbs. each time.  If I would have continued it, I would have lost all 20 lbs.  I quit using the drug because I would get short term memory loss.  I asked my doctor if the memory loss was one of the side effects of the drug, and he said it was not.  He said he never had anyone complain of memory loss from this drug!  But each time I have taken it, I do get memory loss or a little "spacey."  Once I go off the drug, I don't have the memory loss.  It's not major memory loss, just little things, like forgetting where the car keys are; but then I find them.  I hope this info was helpful.  The drug does work with weight loss, though.

column2: djaquayla20012001, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have tried everything to lose weight.  I started taking phendimetrazine 2 weeks ago and I have already lost 10 pounds.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After using it for a while, it no longer helps you lose weight, you just think it does. You still have to depend on diet and exercise to make a difference; I made the mistake of thinking it was the pills.
